Atlas Informatics- the First Spinout of Ivy Softworks

Recruiting impact-Responsible for all hiring across the organization, including product, marketing, and engineering (applications team, machine learning team, and platform and infrastructure team). -Sourced top talent via Entelo and LinkedIn Recruiter, placed in top 10% for Entelo outreach metrics worldwide in 2016-2017.Recruiting strategy: -Contributed to the recruiting vision statement and created the 2016 and 2017 roadmaps.-Transitioned company from Jazz ATS to Jobvite ATS while maintaining data integrity.-Worked with leadership team to streamline interview process, reducing time to hire.Team development:-Led company-wide interview redux and held 1:1 trainings to reinforce best practices.-Defined scope of engineering internship and recruited first 3 participants for the programCommunity engagement:-Represented Atlas Informatics at local events, including Seattle Startup Week and Geekwire Gala.-Spoke on multiple recruiting panels, including STAC, Startup Week and at UW- Seattle.

We are fundamentally changing the idea of what it means to search and remember. For two decades, search engines have been finding what you don’t know, but they can’t find what you’ve forgotten. Regardless of device, where you saw it, or who shared it with you, Atlas from [Ivy Softworks] will extend your memory, connecting the dots, making you smarter and more productive.

Every once in a while, I still get to do some public speaking. Topics have included the future of AI in recruiting, cracking the Seattle talent market, and how to land your first position in technology.Speaking engagements:-Epicodus, School for Aspiring Programmers: 2016-Seattle Startup Week: 2016-Washington State Opportunity Scholarship (WSOS @UW): 2017-Seattle Talent Acquisition Collaborative panelist: 2017

-Served as a full-cycle, technical recruiter for a variety of clients, from scrappy startups to enterprise giants.-Became the top performing recruiter in company history, placing 40+ candidates and generating over $1M in revenue for the company in 18 months.-Sourced primarily via LinkedIn Recruiter, cold-calling, and job boards.-Documented best practices in a 3-page Recruiting Guide upon departure to up-level the team.
Group Sales Development and Integration Intern

•	Displayed superior customer-service skills by handling over 800 calls (over 100 hours) on the Group Getaways, Weddings, and Youth Sales markets, registering positive feedback on after call surveys.•	Led the department in sales conversion for Disney’s Night of Joy, a hard ticket event that involves several thousand group ticket sales annually.•      Created a shared, departmental spreadsheet that quantifies the productivity of individual workers by tracking call volume and sales conversion metrics for further analysis.

recommendations: September 12, 2017, Nick worked with Evan in different groups

"I had a pleasure to be sourced and recruited by Evan". Most of the time, for engineers even writing the above sentence feels uncomfortable, as usually recruiting process is done wrong. In the case of Atlas Informatics one of the main reasons I've joined the team was actually due to exceptional interview process. It is not aggressive, but assertive and rigorous. Thanks to the flow Evan and team have put together, I was able to join a strong team of like minded and focused engineers. Great team and great product are main reasons people happy to work at startups.

Unlike almost 90% of the recruiters one may encounter during job hunting, Evan takes his time to plan the hiring flow and make adjustments per candidate's situation; his eagle eyes and sensor can quickly cover small but important details beyond only profession. He always has positive vibe and patient which makes working with him easy and relaxed. I highly recommend Evan based on my time working with him for the past years.

Evan is a talented recruiter who really excels at learning about a candidate's experiences and what they're looking for next. As a candidate, Evan made me feel comfortable with the interview process, quickly answered any questions I had, and patiently explained anything I didn't understand. When I was looking for a new position, Evan went out of his way to connect me with potential employers and provided me with invaluable advice. In both experiences, Evan treated me with respect and never once made me feel under pressure to make a decision.

Evan is an extraordinary recruiter, one that has set the bar high for what it really means to connect with people on a professional and cultural level. He has a keen eye for talent which perfectly matches his ability to pull conversations, formal and informal, into a deeper level in order to truly understand one's skill set, personality, and proper fit in a company.I had the honor of working with Evan as I was recruited for an internship at Atlas Informatics. From my experience, I can confidently say that he is one of the most genuine and passionate people I have ever met, professionally and personally. I have no doubt Evan will continue to be successful in building strong relationships for any company as it comes second nature to him.

January 2, 2017, Evan reported directly to Stephanie

Stephanie has been an exceptional leader, mentor, guide, and friend to me over the past year. She's knowledgeable, experimental, and willing to challenge preconceived notions of how recruiting and HR "should be done" to find superior solutions for all. Even more importantly, Stephanie invests in people and created an environment at Atlas where we genuinely care about helping each other grow. If you're ever fortunate enough to work with/for Stephanie, you'll likely be better for it.

summary: My recruiting philosophy is simple: be kind, be attentive, foster long-term relationships and never stop learning. If you aren't taking steps forward, this industry will leave you behind.Inspired to push boundaries and grow in new ways, I joined Atlas Informatics to build an innovative, robust recruiting engine to grow our dynamic team and to redefine how companies search for talent.Previously, I worked for iMatch as a full-cycle recruiter and had the pleasure of guiding over 40 candidates successfully through the recruitment process, from initial sourcing and outreach to eventual placement at their new company.My goal is to continue connecting with exceptional people and growing as much as I can along the way, hopefully we have the chance to meet during this journey!
